result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis

records.addlTxt:
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated October 17, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Office Contact. Defendant REGAINED contact with JusticePoint.

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis appeared by video.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Offer remains open. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Jury Trial scheduled for November 13, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services AMENDED Status Report; received and filed. 
Missed Office Contact.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated August 31, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Office Contact.

Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 9:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case re-called. Defendant appeared for Status hearing. Court VACATED Bench Warrant. Court addressed JusticePoint Supervision. Court ADMONISHED Defendant. Court REINSTATED JusticePoint Supervision and INCREASED the Level of Supervision. Court ordered Defendant to contact JusticePoint Case Manager by EOD on July 1, 2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court HELD BAIL for recompense to be determined at the end of the case.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated June 21, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Scheduled Alternate Contact.

22RM029140  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS
06/06/2022
Letter from Defendant, (Keyshawn Lewis- 2022003480 Milwaukee County Jail, 901 N 9th Street, Milwaukee WI 53233)
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in Court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Defendant and Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Court reviewed Defendant's Motions and Defense counsel's Motion. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Defendant confirmed that he wanted Attorney Rosenberg to continue representing him; therefore, Defense no longer requested to withdraw. 

Bail hearing proceeded. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Court LOWERED Cash Bail. 

Defense received partial discovery material from the State, and requested time to review and meet with Defendant. Court granted request. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defense Motion to Withdraw due to Breakdown; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant's Motion for Production of Discovery.  (Keyshawn M. Lewis - #2022003480, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Withdraw Counsel.  (Keyshawn M. Lewis - #2022003480, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in Court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has NOT received discovery material from the State. Defense advised the Court that this is the only case holding Defendant in custody. Court ordered State to provide discovery material to Defense by May 26, 2022. Defense requested to address bail. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond and Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Bail/Bond and Status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant will appear will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case was incorrectly tabbed to Branch 4. Parties advised case assigned to Judge Feiss Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  (18 pages) commencing  03-29-2022 by  AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding felony conviction case #21cf895. Sworn for the State: City of MKE Detective Malden Dukic. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests arraignment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TSB; KJM

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keyshawn Marquiest Lewis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in hospital, will do IA when released
